Sentencas: A planar solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) operated with hydrogen at T = 1,123 K was equipped with an optically transparent anode flow field to apply species concentration measurements by 1D laser Raman scattering.
Titulo: A novel concept for in situ gas-phase laser Raman spectroscopy for solid oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: The flow channels had a cross section of 3 mm x 4 mm and a length of 40 mm.
Titulo: A novel concept for in situ gas-phase laser Raman spectroscopy for solid oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: The beam from a pulsed high-power frequency-doubled Nd:YAG laser (lambda = 532 nm) was directed through one channel and the Raman-scattered light from different molecular species was imaged onto an intensified CCD camera.
Titulo: A novel concept for in situ gas-phase laser Raman spectroscopy for solid oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: The main goal of the study was an assessment of the potential of this experimental configuration for a quantitative determination of local gas concentrations.
Titulo: A novel concept for in situ gas-phase laser Raman spectroscopy for solid oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: The paper describes the configuration of the optically accessible SOFC, the laser system and optical setup for 1D Raman spectroscopy as well as the challenges associated with the measurements.
Titulo: A novel concept for in situ gas-phase laser Raman spectroscopy for solid oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: Important aspects like laser pulse shaping, signal background and signal quality are addressed.
Titulo: A novel concept for in situ gas-phase laser Raman spectroscopy for solid oxide fuel cell research

Sentencas: Examples of measured species concentration profiles are presented.
Titulo: A novel concept for in situ gas-phase laser Raman spectroscopy for solid oxide fuel cell research
